alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:55PM MST until August 02 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST FOR THE GRAND CANYON SOUTH RIM IN COCONINO COUNTY... At 254 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hopi Point At Grand Canyon, or 18 miles west of Desert View at Grand Canyon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Hermit`s Rest, Shoshone Point, Pima Point, Bright Angel Point, South Rim Visitors Center, Hopi Point, and Grand Canyon Village. This includes State Route 64 near mile marker 237. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
